title: When do you capitalize titles? - Quora

response.answer_text: When? You capitalise titles when they’re printed on the outside book covers, the spine, or at the top of an essay or similar. Titles are titles. How to capitalise a title is another matter. You can have the traditional “title case,” which is in all capitals. You can have the traditional “headline case” favoured by many North American newspapers (sometimes called “deck style” by printing people). You can have the traditional “sentence case” favoured mostly by UK publications and most British English users. Or you can even set the title completely in lowercase for special effect (such as the eccentric author E.E. Cummings did). Examples:— THIS TITLE IS IN TITLE CASEThis Title Is in Headline CaseThis title is in sentence case, as favoured by British publicationsthis title is completely in lowercaseThanks for the A2A.
